back_cards.example_en: She voted against the new policy at work.
The ladder leaned against the wall.
The bright flowers stood out against the dark forest.
They wore jackets against the cold wind.
Our team played against the champions last night.
She runs in the park every morning.
He runs a small bakery downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: To flow or move like a liquid.
back_cards.example_en: The river runs through the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: To compete in a race or election.
back_cards.example_en: She decided to run for class president.
The meeting ran longer than expected.

back_cards.definition_en: An informal term for a man.
back_cards.example_en: That guy helped me carry my groceries.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a general sense.
back_cards.example_en: The guys at the office threw a surprise party.
Hey, guy, you dropped your wallet!
The delivery guy arrived early today.
The guy in the movie was really brave.
We talked about our weekend plans.
The hike took about two hours.
Papers were scattered about the desk.

back_cards.definition_en: On the verge of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: He was about to leave when it started raining.

back_cards.definition_en: An instance or example of something.
back_cards.example_en: This is a case of mistaken identity.
The lawyer won her case in court.
She packed her glasses in a protective case.
The detective solved a tough case.
In any case, we should be prepared.
She asked a question during the lecture.

back_cards.definition_en: A problem or issue to be discussed.
back_cards.example_en: The question of funding was debated.
There’s no question about his honesty.
The quiz covered questions on history.
It’s a question of time before we finish.
She loves her work as a teacher.

back_cards.definition_en: Effort or activity to achieve a result.
back_cards.example_en: The garden required a lot of work.
His painting is a beautiful work of art.
I have some work to finish tonight.
He left for work early this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: The time after sunset and before sunrise.
back_cards.example_en: The stars were bright last night.
We had a fun game night with friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of darkness or gloom.
back_cards.example_en: It was a long night during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for rest or sleep.
back_cards.example_en: She read a book before bed last night.
The flowers live longer with proper care.
They live in a small village by the sea.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience life in a certain way.

back_cards.example_en: The event will be streamed live online.
They played a soccer game in the park.
The kids enjoyed a board game night.
She’s always ahead in the game at work.
The forest is full of game like deer.
The chess game lasted three hours.
A large number of birds flew overhead.
She gave me her phone number.
He’s number one on the leaderboard.
The package has a tracking number.

back_cards.definition_en: To compose a text or letter.
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a note to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To create a story or article.
back_cards.example_en: He writes for a local newspaper.
She wrote the recipe on a card.
He wrote a poem about the sunset.
They write emails to clients daily.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry or take something to a place.
back_cards.example_en: She brought cookies to the party.
The news brought tears to her eyes.
He brought a new plan to the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To lead to a specific outcome.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech brought applause from the crowd.
The kids played without the house.
She saved money for a new phone.
He dreams of making a lot of money.
I found money in an old jar.
She has a lot of homework tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of items or people.
back_cards.example_en: They bought a lot of new books.
They built a house on that lot.
This lot of apples is fresh.
We had a lot of fun at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: To the greatest extent or degree.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the most talented singer I know.
It was a most enjoyable evening.
Most of the cake was eaten.
The team with the most points wins.
She read a book about space.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of tickets or items.
back_cards.example_en: I bought a book of stamps.
They made a book for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a larger work.
back_cards.example_en: The Bible has the Book of Genesis.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of connected parts working together.
back_cards.example_en: The solar system crashed during the update.
She uses a system to stay productive.
The subway system is very efficient.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of principles or rules.
The ruling authority of a country.

back_cards.example_en: Democracy is a form of government.
The next bus arrives in ten minutes.
She’s the next speaker at the event.
They live in the next village.
The next item is budget approval.
New York is a busy city.
The city grew around the river.
She works for a tech company.
They enjoyed the company’s company at dinner.
The company performed a new play.
She read a story to the kids.
He shared his story of survival.
The story appeared in the newspaper.
The movie has a great story.
He found a job as a chef.
It’s my job to clean the kitchen.
The repair job took two days.
Raising kids is a tough job.
Her job is managing the store.
She moved the chair to the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate to a new home.
back_cards.example_en: They moved to a new city.
The team moved quickly on the project.
The story moved slowly at first.

back_cards.definition_en: To be required to do something.

back_cards.example_en: We must leave before the storm.
She must be tired after the hike.
The food was bad and tasteless.
The bad kid was bad in class.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you like and trust.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been my friend since childhood.
He’s a friend of the environment.
I made a new friend at work.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in the course of.

back_cards.example_en: During the night, it got cold.
The rain began in the afternoon.
Their love grew stronger over time.
She has a love for music.
It was love at first sight.
His love of hiking is inspiring.

back_cards.definition_en: Every one of a group, individually.

back_cards.example_en: They checked each one of the boxes.
Each of us has a role.
The glue holds the pieces together.
He holds a high position at work.

definition_en.example_en: Each team had a different strategy.
Her style is different from mine.

back_cards.example_en: Add a little salt to the soup.
Have you ever seen a comet?
Whatever ever you do, be honest.
Write the word on the board.
He gave his word he’d help.
I got word from my cousin.
The boss gave the word to start.
Can I have a word with you?
It’s a fact that water freezes.
In fact, he was late again.
The fact is, we need more time.
Do you need anything from the store?
Anything can happen in this game.
Is there anything I can do?
He said nothing in the dark.
It’s a sure way to succeed.
The plan is sure to work.
Are you sure about this decision?
She lives in a small apartment.
The program crashed on my laptop.
The festival has a great program.
Maybe it will rain this afternoon.
It’s maybe a bit too expensive.
You have the right to vote.
The shop is on my right.
The right wing won the election.
The cat hid under the table.
She works under a new boss.
Home is where my kids are.
What kind of dog is that?
This kind of fruit is sweet.
She’s kind in kind to everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: To cease moving or doing something.
back_cards.example_en: The car stopped at the light.
He stopped the leak in time.

back_cards.definition_en: To give money for goods or services.

back_cards.example_en: He paid his bills on time.

back_cards.definition_en: From a past time until now.
After a specific time in the past.
back_cards.example_en: I haven’t seen him since Monday.
Much since has changed since then.
She has an issue with trust.
The name of the game is.
He made a name for himself.
What’s the name of this flower?
I like your idea of fun.
She has power in her swing.

back_cards.definition_en: An informal term for a person.
The upper part of the body.

back_cards.example_en: She’s the head of the team.
The river is the mother of life.
Keep an eye on the kids.
The sunny side of the hill.
She drank a glass of water.
The water in the lake sparkled.
She looks young for her age.
I met her at the park.
The service at the restaurant was great.
The area around the lake is beautiful.
The area of the room is small.
I thank you for your help.
